response:
Imaging is required urgently to define the anatomy of the midbrain lesion and optic neuropathy and to exclude aneurysm, infarct or tumour; CSF and blood tests are needed to confirm demyelination and rule out infectious, autoimmune and systemic inflammatory mimics before high-dose immunosuppression or long-term disease-modifying therapy; neuro-ophthalmic tests quantify optic nerve involvement.
